text:
1. 1.5 lac ki ev lekar limit range me chalna (assume 150km )
2. Every year battery health down hoga, range bhi down hoga.
3. 6-7 saal me range 50-60 ya usase bhi km, kuchh condition me battery bhi kharab ho jayega.
4. New battery approx 90k-100k ki aayegi. 

Bahut saare drawbacks hai. 
Long drive pe nhi ja sakte.
Battery and motor cost very expensive.


Ev spare parts expensive hote hai.

text:
Mene 2017 mein TVS Jupiter liya 52,000 mein aaj tak 65,000 km chala chuka hun,
52 km per liter k average deta hai, 1250 liter petrol kitne ka hoga Rs. 65 (2017)
Rs. 95 (2025), 82 average price. , 1250 × 82 = 1,02,500 
Scooter Price = 52,000 
Fuel cost = 1,02,500
Services cost = 20,000
Insurance = 10,000
Other exp. = 10,000

Total = 1,94,500

Isse lakh guna acha hai abi b😂

text: लेना तो रियल में नहीं चाहिए एक तो km लिमिट का चक्कर है। दूसरा लोग बोलते हैं कि इससे पॉल्यूशन कंट्रोल होता है 70% कोयला से बिजली बनती है । तो कहा से पॉल्यूशन कंट्रोल होता है। 40 या 50 k का बैटरी जोड़ो तो पेट्रोल से ज्यादे पड़ जाता है। क्या हुआ मेरे यहाँ कोई बीमार पड़ा होंडा एक्टिवा से लगातार 60से80km पर hour के स्पीड पर 10या  मिनट में लगभग 15 km hospital पहुंच गए इलेक्ट्रिक होती हो सकता है चार्ज ही नहीं होती। ये उसके लिए है जिसके पास कई गाड़ी है

author: @sonuacademy666

text:
I am writing this email with extreme anger and frustration. I purchased your so-called Chetak Premium Model electric scooter just one year ago, paying a hefty ₹1,50,000 for what I was led to believe was a premium vehicle. Within one month, I started facing repeated issues, and now, within a year, the battery is completely dead.



Your product has not only wasted my money, but cost me my job due to its unreliability. I depended on this scooter for my daily commute, and thanks to your pathetic quality and irresponsible service, I’ve been left stranded multiple times.



Let me make this crystal clear:

Your Gaddi Godam Kamptee Road Service Center in Nagpur is completely useless.

They are rude, non-cooperative, and treat customers like we’re the ones at fault.

They have zero interest in resolving issues, and every visit feels like a punishment.



I’m not going to tolerate this anymore. I will be filing a formal complaint with the Consumer Court and share my experience on every platform possible to warn others against wasting their money on your unreliable products. I will also escalate this with Bajaj directly if needed.



You sold me a defective vehicle, gave me pathetic after-sales service, and now I’ve suffered real financial damage because of it. You owe me either a full replacement of the battery or a refund, and I expect a prompt response—not more silence or fake apologies.
